Description: American Zinc Recycling agreed to  invest approximately $8 million to bring its Chicago refining facility back into compliance with its emissions limits, with improved capture and collection systems for particulate matter and dust. The company also agreed to pay a $530,000 penalty.
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/epa-settlement-american-zinc-recycling-reduce-air-pollution-chicago

Description: American Zinc Recycling settled a federal-state lawsuit citing violations of air, water and hazardous waste environmental laws at its facility in Palmerton, Pennsylvania, delivering environmental and public health benefits, including reduced lead dust exposure, for nearby residents.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/enforcement/american-zing-recycling-corp-settlement
https://www.ahs.dep.pa.gov/NewsRoomPublic/SearchResults.aspx?id=881&typeid=1
